Experiment is the process of obtaining an observation. For example: Toss a coin twice and observe what happens.

结果是实验的可能结果。实验的所有可能结果称为样本空间。抛硬币两次的实验会导致四种可能结果中的一种——尾巴/尾巴、正面/正面、正面/尾部或尾部/正面。

Outcome is the possible result of the experiment. All possible outcomes of the experiment are called the sample space. The experiment oftossing a coin twice results in one of four possible outcomes — Tail/Tail, HeadJHead, Head/Tail, or Tail/Head.

事件是实验的一组结果。一个事件是：观察至少一个头部。该事件由三个结果 HH、HT、TH 组成。复合事件是由两个或多个独立事件组成的事件。

Event is a set of outcomes of the experiment. One event would be: Observe at least one head. This event consists of the three outcomes HH, HT, TH. A compound event is an event composed of two or more separate events.

独立事件- 如果没有事件可以影响另一个事件的概率，则两个事件 A 和 B 是独立的。事件A：抛硬币时观察一个人头。事件B：抛另一枚硬币时观察到一条尾巴。每次抛掷都是独立的，因为第一枚硬币发生的任何事情都不会影响第二枚硬币的抛掷，也不会告诉我们当我们抛掷第二枚硬币时可能发生的结果。

Independent events - two events A and B are independent if no event can influence the probability of the other. Event A: observe one head when flipping a coin. Event B: observe one tail when flipping another coin. Each flip is independent of the other since whatever happens to the first coin cannot influence the flip of the second or tell us what outcome is likely to happen when we flip the second coin.

相互排斥的事件——如果两个事件不能同时发生，即它们没有共同的结果，则它们是相互排斥的。抛出一枚硬币。有两个事件：观察头部或观察尾巴。观察头部就排除了观察尾巴的可能性。 如果两个事件具有一个或多个共同结果，则它们是非互斥的。抛出一个骰子。事件A：观察四。事件B：观察偶数。这些事件有一个共同的结果，因为“偶数”由数字 2、4 和 6 组成。

Mutually exclusive events - two events are mutually exclusive if they cannot happen at the same time i.e. they have no outcomes in common. A single coin is tossed. There are two events: observing a head or observing a tail. Observing a head excludes the possibility of observing a tail. Two events are non-mutually exclusive if they have one or more outcomes in common. A single die is tossed. Event A: observe a four. Event B: observe an even number. These events have one outcome in common since an"even number" consists of the numbers 2, 4, and 6.

概率- 一个介于 0 和 1 之间的数字，用于衡量事件在长期内发生的可能性有多大。概率为 1 表示事件肯定会发生，概率为 0 表示事件不可能发生。

Probability - a number between 0 and 1 that measures how likely an event is to happen over the long run. A probability of 1 means an event happens with certainty and a probability of 0 means it is impossible for an event to happen.

一组结果的算术平均值通常称为这些结果的平均值。要计算数字 1、8、6、4、7 的平均值，我们将这些数字相加 - 26 - 然后除以 5 = 5.2。

Arithmetic mean of a set of outcomes is usually called the average value of these outcomes. To find the mean of the numbers 1,8,6,4,7, we add the numbers together - 26 - and divide by 5 = 5.2.

变异性显示结果围绕算术平均值的集中或分散程度。

Variability shows how concentrated or spread out the outcomes are around the arithmetic mean.

如果我们进行大量实验，期望值是我们期望观察到的平均值。也称为期望值 - 所有可能结果的概率加权总和。

Expectation is the average value we expect to observe if we perform a large number of experiments. Also called expected value - the probability-weighted sum of all possible outcomes.

人口- 某些事物的总数 - 结果、对象、事件等。它是一组至少具有一个共同特征的群体，我们的数据样本就是从中选择的。

Population - the total number of something - outcomes, objects, events, etc. It is a group that has at least one characteristic in common from which our sample of data is selected.

样本- 为得出有关人口的结论而研究的具有代表性和随机抽取的人口的一部分。样本越大，我们对概率的估计就越好。但请注意，重要的是样本的绝对大小（例如被问及的人数），而不是样本占总体的比例。来自整个美国的 3,000 个随机样本比来自特定大学的 40 个样本更具预测性。随机样本是总体中每一项被选中的可能性均等的样本。

Sample - a representative and randomly taken part of the population that is studied in order to draw conclusions about the population. The larger the sample, the better our estimate of the probability. But observe that what is essential is the absolute size of the sample (e.g. the number of people who’ve been asked), not its proportion of the population. A random sample of 3,000 from the entire U.S. is more predictive than a sample of 40 from a particular university. A random sample is one in which every item in the population is equally likely to be chosen.

我们如何确定事件发生的概率？

How do we decide the probability of an event?

概率定律告诉我们经过大量试验可能会发生什么。这意味着我们可以期望对长期平均可能发生的事情做出合理的预测，但我们无法预测特定事件的结果。

The laws of probability tell us what is likely to happen over a large number of trials. This means we can expect to make reasonable predictions what on average are likely to happen over the long run, but we can’t predict the outcome of a particular event.

概率的度量方法有逻辑法、相对频率法和主观法三种。

There are three ways to measure probability: the logical way, the relative frequency way, and the subjective way.

合乎逻辑的方式

The logical way

在我们知道结果的数量并且所有这些结果的可能性相同的情况下，可以使用逻辑方法。例如，在机会游戏中，我们通过将有利于事件的结果数（产生我们寻找的结果）除以可能结果的总数来找到概率。请注意，只有当我们能够将一种情况分析为同样可能的结果时，才能应用此定义。

The logical way can be used in situations where we know the number of outcomes and where all these outcomes are equally likely. For example in games of chance, we find the probability by dividing the number of outcomes that are favourable to the event (yield the outcome we look for) with the total number of possible outcomes. Observe that this definition can only be applied if we can analyze a situation into equally likely outcomes.

抛硬币时我们观察到正面朝上的概率是多少？同样可能的有利结果的数量是一个（正面），而同样可能的结果的总数是两个（正面和尾部），因此概率是1 / 2或 50%。

What is the probability that we observe one head when tossing a coin? The number of equally likely favourable outcomes is one (head) and the total number of possible equally likely outcomes is two (head and tail) and therefore the probability is 1/2 or 50%.

相对频率

Relative frequency

当一个实验可以重复多次时，概率是事件发生的次数相对于无限次实验的比例。在大多数情况下，我们不知道事件发生的概率。为什么？因为我们无法知道所有的结果。然后，我们必须尝试通过进行实验或寻找有关过去某事件发生频率的代表性信息来估计长期相对频率。

When an experiment can be repeated many times, probability is the proportion of times the event happened in relation to an infinite number of experiments. In most cases we don’t know the probability of an event. Why? Because we can’t know all the outcomes. We must then try to estimate the long-term relative frequency by performing experiments or by finding representative information about how often an event happened in the past.

我们所说的代表性是指信息必须基于在基本相同的条件下对同一参考类别进行的大量独立实验或观察的历史数据的相对频率。参考类别是结果分布已知或可以合理估计的类别。我们检查的相关案例越多，我们正确估计潜在概率的机会就越大。

By representative we mean that the information must be based on the relative frequency of historical data over a large number of independent experiments or observations of the same reference class under essentially the same conditions. The reference class is the one for which the distribution of outcomes is known or can be reasonable estimated. The more relevant cases we examine, the better our chance is to estimate correctly the underlying probability.

做一个实验来测试你甩头的可能性有多大。抛硬币 1000 次，观察会发生什么。如果正面出现 400 次，则相对频率或抛出正面次数（事件发生的次数）与总抛出次数（实验次数）之间的分数为 400/1000。抛硬币 2000 次，观察会发生什么。如果正面朝上 900 次，则相对频率为 900/2000。投掷次数越多，事件的理论概率与其发生的相对频率之间的差异就越小。在这种情况下，它将向值1 / 2移动

Conduct an experiment to test how likely it is that you toss head. Toss a coin 1000 times and observe what happens. If you got heads 400 times the relative frequency or the fraction between the number of tossed heads (number of times the events happened) and the total number of tosses (number of experiments) is 400/1000. Toss a coin 2000 times and observe what happens. If you got heads 900 times the relative frequency is 900/2000. The more tosses, the less the difference will be between an events theoretical probability and the relative frequency with which it happens. In this case it will move towards the value 1/2

亏损的频率是多少？损失如何随时间分布？它们的大小是多少？

What is the frequency of losses? How are losses distributed over time? What is their magnitude?

保险公司使用相对频率。他们根据对导致他们支付的特定事件发生的可能性的估计来确定他们的保费。如果他们假设过去是未来的代表性指南，他们就会试图通过观察特定事故的过去频率来找出特定“事故”的相对频率。

Insurance companies use relative frequencies. They base their premiums on an estimate of how likely it is that a specific event that cause them to pay happen. If they assume the past is a representative guide for the future they try to find out the relative frequency of a specific "accident" by observing past frequencies of specific accidents.

假设给定房屋燃烧的概率为 0.3%。这意味着保险公司找到了大量房屋的历史数据和其他指标（例如参考类是“给定区域50年的火灾数据”）并发现，在过去，3 out of 1,特定区域的 000 间房屋将被烧毁。这也意味着，假设这些火灾的原因没有变化，我们可以预测未来发生火灾的比例大致相同。

Suppose the probability that a given house will burn is 0.3%. This means that the insurance company found historical data and other indicators about a large number of houses (for example the reference class is"50 years of data of fires in a given area") and discovered that, in the past, 3 out of1,000 houses in a given area will burn. It also means that, assuming there are no changes in the causes of these fires, we can predict approximately the same proportion of fires in the future.

一家保险公司知道，在特定年份，一定比例的保单持有人会发生事故。他们不知道是哪些人，但他们通过为许多人投保来分散风险。一个人无法预测的事情，对于一大群人来说却是可以预测的。但他们必须确保事件是独立的，并且不会有单个事件或独立事件的汇合影响多个保单持有人，导致保险公司一次支付多项索赔。例如，如果发生大火，一家为同一街区的多座建筑物提供火灾保险的保险公司可能面临倒闭。

An insurance company knows that in a given year a certain percentage of their policyholders will have an accident. They don’t know which ones, but they diversify their risk by insuring many individuals. What is unpredictable for one person can be predictable for a large population. But they must make sure the events are independent and that not a single event or a confluence of independent events affects multiple policyholders causing the insurer to pay out on many claims at one time. For example, an insurance company who provides fire insurance to a number of buildings in a single block may face ruin if a large fire happens.

主观概率

Subjective probability

如果实验不可重复，或者没有代表性的历史相对频率或可比数据，那么概率就是衡量我们个人对事件发生可能性的信念程度的量度。我们必须使用任何可用信息进行主观评估或个人估计。但我们不能只为事件分配任何数字。他们必须同意概率规则。

If an experiment is not repeatable or when there is no representative historical relative frequency, or comparable data, the probability is then a measure of our personal degree of belief in the likelihood of an event happening. We have to make a subjective evaluation or a personal estimation using whatever information is available. But we can’t just assign any number to events. They must agree with the rules of probability.

纽约游骑兵队的支持者可能会说，“我相信纽约游骑兵队有 90% 的机会赢得下一场比赛，因为他们一直打得很好。”

A New York Rangers supporter might say,"I believe that the NY Rangers have a 90% chance of winning their next match since they have been playing so well."

概率规则

Rules of probability

当两个事件是独立的（没有事件可以影响另一个事件的概率）时，它们都发生的概率是它们各自概率的乘积。我们可以这样写：A 和 B 都会发生 = P(A) x P(B)。

When two events are independent (no event can influence the probability of the other), the probability that they both will happen is the product of their individual probabilities. We can write this as: Both A and B will happen = P(A) x P(B).

一个公司有两个独立的制造过程。在流程一中，5% 的产品有缺陷，在流程二中，有 3%。如果我们从每个过程中选择一个项目，那么两个项目都有缺陷的可能性有多大？0.15% (0.05 x 0.03)。

A company has two independent manufacturing processes. In process one, 5% of the produced items are defective, and in process two, 3%. If we pick one item from each process, how likely is it that both items are defective? 0.15% (0.05 x 0.03).

如果事件是相关的，则更改此规则。在许多情况下，一个事件的概率取决于其他事件的结果。事件通常以某种方式相关，因此如果一个事件发生，它会或多或少地增加或减少另一个事件发生的可能性。例如，如果我们掷骰子，事件 A 是：观察到一个偶数，而事件 B：观察到一个小于 4 的数字，那么假设我们知道 B 已经发生，概率是 1/3。这称为条件概率或在其他事件发生的情况下事件发生的概率。条件概率涉及相关事件。A 给定 B 的条件概率是 1/3，因为我们知道 B 是 1,2 或 3，只有 2 意味着事件 A。

This rule is changed if the events are dependent. In many situations the probability of an event depends on the outcome of some other event. Events are often related in a way so that if one event happens, it makes the other event more or less likely to happen. For example, if we toss a die and event A is: observe an even number, and event B: observe a number less than 4, then given we know B has happened, the probability is 1/3. This is called a conditional probability or the probability that an event happen given that some other event has happened. Conditional probabilities involve dependent events. The conditional probability of A given B is 1/3 since we know B was either 1,2 or 3 and only 2 implies event A.

假设至少有一个男孩，那么在一个二胎家庭中有两个男孩的概率是多少？问：会发生什么或同样可能发生的结果数量是多少？男孩/男孩——女孩/女孩——男孩/女孩——女孩/男孩。因为我们已经知道有“至少一个男孩”，所以我们可以排除场景“女孩/女孩”。因此概率为 1/3 或 33%。

What is the probability that there are two boys in a two-child family given that there is at least one boy? Ask: What can happen or what are the number of outcomes that are equally likely to happen? Boy/Boy — Girl/Girl— Boy/Girl — Girl/Boy. Since we already know that there is"at least one boy", we can rule out scenario"Girl/Girl." The probability is therefore 1/3 or 33%.

假设第一个孩子是男孩，那么二胎家庭中有两个男孩的概率是多少？同样可能发生的结果数量是：男孩/男孩 - 女孩/女孩 - 男孩/女孩 - 女孩/男孩。由于我们已经知道大孩子是男孩，我们可以排除场景 GB 和 GG。概率是50%。

What is the probability that there are two boys in a two-child family given that the first-born is a boy? The number of outcomes that are equally likely to happen are: Boy/Boy — Girl/Girl — Boy/Girl — Girl/Boy. Since we already know that the older child is a boy, we can rule out scenario GB and GG. The probability is 50%.

条件概率中的一个问题已经引起了许多数学教授的问题，那就是蒙提霍尔困境。专栏作家 Marilyn vos Savant (Parade 1990, Sept 9, p. 13.) 提出了以下问题：

A problem in conditional probability that has caused many mathematics professors problems, is the Monty Hall Dilemma. The columnist Marilyn vos Savant (Parade 1990, Sept 9, p. 13.) asked the following problem:

“假设你在一个游戏节目中，你可以选择三扇门。一扇门后面是一辆汽车，其他门后面是山羊。你选择一扇门，比如说第一，然后主持人，谁知道门后面是什么，打开另一扇门，比如 3 号门，里面有一只山羊。然后他对你说，“你想选择 2 号门吗？” 改变你的选择对你有利吗？”

"Suppose you’re on a game show, and you’re given the choice of three doors. Behind one door is a car; behind the others, goats. You pick a door, say No. 1, and the host, who knows what’s behind the doors, opens another door, say No. 3, which has a goat. He then says to you, ‘Do you want to pick door No. 2?’ Is it to your advantage to switch your choice?"

你会怎么回答？假设我们总是有机会转换。制作一张可能的结果表，并测试换门需要多少结果。

How would you answer? Assume we always have the opportunity to switch. Make a table of possible outcomes and test in how many outcomes it pays to switch doors.

门 1

Door 1

2号门

Door 2

3号门

Door 3

车

Car

山羊

Goat

山羊

Goat

山羊

Goat

车

Car

山羊

Goat

山羊

Goat

山羊

Goat

车

Car

 

 

假设您选择了 1 号门。那么如果汽车在 1、2 或 3 号门，后果是什么？

Assume you choose door number 1. What are then the consequences if the car is in door 1, 2 or 3?

门后的车

Car behind door

主人开门

Host opens door

你切换

You switch

你不换

You don’t switch

1个

1

2个

2

失去

Lose

赢

Win

2个

2

3个

3

赢

Win

失去

Lose

3个

3

2个

2

赢

Win

失去

Lose
   

2/3

2/3

  1/3

 

 

我们应该总是换门，因为我们有 2/3 的机会获胜。他们解决这个问题的关键是我们在比赛前就知道（有条件的）主持人知道每扇门后面是什么，并且总是打开一扇门后面有一只山羊。

We should always switch doors since we win 2/3 of the time. They key to this problem is that we know ahead of the game (conditional) that the host knows what is behind each door and always opens a door with a goat behind it.

当两个事件相互排斥（不能同时发生）时，一个或另一个发生的概率是它们各自概率的总和。我们可以这样写：要么 A 要么 B 会发生 = P(A) + P(B)。

When two events are mutually exclusive (can’t both happen at the same time), the probability that one or the other will happen is the sum of their respective probabilities. We can write this as: Either A or B will happen = P(A) + P(B).

当一个骰子被掷一次时，我们得到 2 或 4 的概率是多少？有 6 个结果，两个事件（“得到二分”和“得到四分”）没有共同的结果。我们不能在同一次掷球中同时得到 2 和 4。有多少有利的结果，或者我们有多少种方法可以得到两个？六分之一。我们有多少种方法可以得到四？六分之一。我们得到 4 或 6 的概率是 1/6 + 1/6 = 33%。

What is the probability that we get either a two or a four when a single die is tossed once? There are 6 outcomes and the two events ("getting a two" and"getting a four") have no outcomes in common. We cant get both a two and a four on the same toss. How many favourable outcomes are there or in how many ways can we get a two? In one out of six. In how many ways can we get a four? In one out of six. The probability that we get a four or a six is 1/6 + 1/6 = 33%.

当两个事件是非互斥的（两个事件可以同时发生）时，其中至少一个事件发生的概率等于两个事件的概率减去两个事件都发生的概率之和。我们可以将此互补规则写为：P(A) + P(B) - P(A and B)。

When two events are non-mutually exclusive (both can happen at the same time), the probability that at least one of them will happen is equal to the sum of the probabilities of the two events minus the probability that both events happen. We can write this complementary rule as: P(A) + P(B) — P(A and B).

假设洛杉矶青少年拥有冲浪板的概率为 25%，自行车为 85%，两者都拥有为 20%。如果我们随机选择一个洛杉矶青少年，他或她拥有冲浪板或自行车的概率是 (0.25 + 0.85) - 0.20 = 90%。这些事件有两个共同的结果，因为这个少年可以同时拥有冲浪板和自行车。

Assume that the probability a Los Angeles teenager owns a surfing board is 25%, a bicycle 85%, and owning both 20%. If we randomly choose a Los Angeles teenager, the probability that he or she owns a surfing board or a bicycle is (0.25 + 0.85) — 0.20 = 90%. These events had two outcomes in common since the teenager could have both a surfing board and a bicycle.

有时，如果我们把问题倒过来，处理问题会更容易。事件不发生的概率是 1 减去它发生的概率。如果事件 A 的概率是 30%，那么事件不会发生的概率是 70%，因为“不是事件 A”是事件 A 的补集。事件发生的概率与事件发生的概率之和相同的事件没有发生总是 1。

Sometimes it is easier to deal with problems if we turn them backwards. The probability of an event not happening is 1 minus the probability it will happen. If the probability of an event A is 30%, then the probability that the event won’t happen is 70% because"not event A" is the complement of the event A. The sum of probability of an event happening and probability of the same event not happening is always 1.

一个骰子四次掷出至少六次的概率是多少？我们把问题反过来，计算“四次掷骰子都没有得到任何六点”的概率。有四项独立的事件——第一次投掷没有得到六分。..second...每个的概率是 5/6 因为有五个结果 (1,2,3,4,5) 导致事件“没有六个”并且每个都独立于之前发生的事情。这意味着得不到任何六的概率是 5/6 x 5/6 x 5/6x 5/6 或 48.2%。因此，“得到至少一个六的概率”是 1 -0.482 或 51.8%。

What is the probability that we get at least one six in four rolls of a single die? We turn the question around and calculate the probability of"not getting any sixes in four rolls of a die". There are four independent events — not getting a six on the first throw. ..second... The probability of each one is 5/6 since there are five outcomes (1,2,3,4,5) which results in the event"no six" and each is independent of what happened before. This means that the probability of not getting any sixes are 5/6 x 5/6 x 5/6x 5/6 or 48.2%. Therefore"the probability of getting at least one six" is 1 -0.482 or 51.8%.

计算可能的结果

Counting possible outcomes

乘法原理说，如果一个事件可以以“n”种不同的方式发生，而第二个事件可以独立于第一个以“m”种不同的方式发生，那么这两个事件可以以 nm 种不同的方式发生。

The multiplication principle says that if one event can happen in"n" different ways, and a second event can happen independent of the first in"m" different ways, the two events can happen in nm different ways.

假设洛杉矶和纽约之间有 4 个不同的航班，纽约和波士顿之间有 3 个航班，波士顿和百慕大之间有 5 个航班。假设我们可以在任何规定的航班之间转机，那么行程的数量是 4 x 3 x 5 = 60。

Suppose there are 4 different flights between Los Angeles and New York, 3 between New York and Boston and 5 between Boston and Bermuda. The number of itineraries assuming we can connect between any of the stated flights are 4 x 3 x 5 = 60.

排列或重新排列意味着我们可以以不同的方式排列或排列多个对象。

Permutations or rearrangements mean the different ways we can order or arrange a number of objects.

我们有 3 顶帽子可供选择——一顶黑色、一顶白色和一顶棕色。如果白、黑、棕的顺序不同于黑、白、棕的顺序，我们有多少种排列方式？这与询问三顶帽子有多少种排列相同，一次取三顶。我们可以用 6 种方式排列帽子：黑-白-棕、黑-棕-白、白黑-棕、白-棕-黑、棕-白-黑、棕-黑-白。

We have 3 hats to choose from — one black, one white and one brown. In how many ways can we arrange them if the order white, black and brown is differentfrom the order black, white and brown? This is the same as asking how many permutations there are with three hats, taken three at a time. We can arrange the hats in 6 ways: Black-White-Brown, Black-Brown-White, WhiteBlack-Brown, White-Brown-Black, Brown-White-Black, Brown-Black-White.

另一种思考方式：我们将三个盒子排成一行，在每个盒子里放一顶不同的帽子。我们可以用三种方式填充第一个框，因为我们可以在所有三种帽子之间进行选择。然后我们可以用两种方式填充第二个框，因为我们现在只能在两顶帽子之间进行选择。我们只能用一种方式填充第三个盒子，因为我们只剩下一顶帽子了。这意味着我们可以用 3 x2x 1 =6 种方式填充盒子。

Another way to think about this: We have three boxes in a row where we put a different hat in each box. We can fill the first box in three ways, since we can choose between all three hats. We can then fill the second box in two ways, since we now can choose between only two hats. We can fill the third box in only one way, since we have only one hat left. This means we can fill the box in 3 x2x 1 =6 ways.

另一种写法是 3！如果我们有 n (6) 个盒子并且可以从所有盒子中进行选择，则有 n (6) 个选择。然后我们剩下 n-1 (5) 个选项用于二号框，n-2 (4) 个选项用于三号框，依此类推。n 个盒子的排列数为 n!。什么！-Factorial - 表示从 1 到 n 的所有数字的乘积。

Another way to write this is 3! If we have n (6) boxes and can choose from all of them, there are n (6) choices. Then we are left with n-1 (5) choices for box number two, n-2 (4) choices for box number three and so on. The number of permutations of n boxes is n!. What n! -Factorial - means is the product of all numbers from 1 to n.

假设我们在家里吃晚饭，12 个人围坐在一张桌子旁。有多少座位安排是可能的？第一个进入房间的人可以在十二把椅子中选择，第二个进入房间的人可以在十一把椅子中选择，依此类推，也就是说有 12 把！或 479,001,600 种不同的座位安排。

Suppose we have a dinner in our home with 12 people sitting around a table. How many seating arrangements are possible? The first person that enters the room can choose between twelve chairs, the second between eleven chairs and so on, meaning there are 12! or 479,001,600 different seating arrangements.

我们可以从一组 n 个对象中排列 r 个对象的方式称为一次从 r 个中取出 n 个对象的排列，定义为 n! 我（nr）！

The number of ways we can arrange r objects from a group of n objects is called a permutation of n objects taken r at a time and is defined as n! I (n-r)!

保险箱有 100 个数字。要打开保险箱，窃贼需要选择正确的 3 个不同的数字。有可能吗？从 100 位数字排列 3 位数字的排列或排列方式的数量为 970,200 (100!/(100-3)l)。如果每个排列都需要窃贼 5 秒，假设 24 小时工作日，所有排列将在 56 天内尝试。

A safe has 100 digits. To open the safe a burglar needs to pick the correct 3 different numbers. Is it likely? The number of permutations or ways of arranging 3 digits from 100 digits is 970,200 (100!/(100-3)l). If every permutation takes the burglar 5 seconds, all permutations are tried in 56 days assuming a 24-hour working day.

组合意味着我们可以从一组对象中选择多个不同对象的不同方式，其中不涉及顺序，只是选择它们的方式的数量。

Combinations means the different ways we can choose a number of different objects from a group of objects where no order is involved, just the number of ways of choosing them.

如果我们可以从草莓 (S)、香草 (V) 和巧克力 (C) 中选择而不重复口味，我们可以通过多少种方式组合 2 种口味的冰淇淋？我们可以通过 3 种方式组合它们：SV、SC、VC。VS和SV是同款冰淇淋的组合。顺序无关紧要。顶部的香草与底部的香草相同。

In how many ways can we combine 2 flavors of ice cream if we can choose from strawberry (S), vanilla (V), and chocolate (C) without repeated flavors? We can combine them in 3 ways: SV, SC, VC. VS and SV are a combination of the same ice creams. The order doesn’t matter. Vanilla on the top is the same as vanilla on the bottom.

我们可以从一组 n 个对象中选择 r 个对象的方法的数量称为一次选择 r 个 n 个对象的组合，定义为 n! 我 r！（nr）！

The number of ways we can select r objects from a group of n objects is called a combination of n objects taken r at a time and is defined as n! I r!(n-r)!

我们可以从一组 10 个人中选出 3 个人的方法数是 120 (10!/3!(10-3)1)。

The number of ways we can select 3 people taken from a group of 10 people is 120 (10!/3!(10-3)1).

二项分布

The binomial distribution

假设我们进行有 10 个问题的真假测试。我们对这个问题一无所知。我们所能做的就是猜测。要通过这个测试，我们必须正确回答 5 个问题。我们可能通过猜测来做到这一点吗？

Suppose we take a true-false test with 10 questions. We don’t know anything about the subject. All we can do is guess. To pass this test, we must answer exactly 5 questions correct. Are we likely to do that by guessing?

我们应该如何推理？问：当我们猜测时，有多少个同样可能的独立结果？有两种可能的结果。我们要么对，要么错。如果测试只有一个问题，我们猜对答案的概率是 50%。我们猜错答案的概率也是50%（1-猜对答案的概率）。

How should we reason? Ask: How many equally likely independent outcomes are there when we guess? There are 2 possible outcomes. Either we are right or wrong. If the test only had one question, the probability that we guess the right answer is 50%. The probability that we guess the wrong answer is also 50% (1- the probability of guessing the right answer).

等可能结果的总数是多少？由于每个问题都有 2 个可能的结果，并且有 10 个问题，因此总共有 2 10 个结果或 1,024 种可能的对错组合。我们可以用 1,024 种不同的方式回答测试。有利结果的数量是多少？我们只有一种方法可以正确（或错误）地回答所有 10 个问题。他们都必须是对的（或错的）。因此，通过猜测将 10 个答案全部正确或错误的机会是 1024 分之一。这意味着如果我们参加 1,024 次测试并且每次都随机猜测答案，那么我们应该期望得到所有 10 个答案的概率是 1,024 次中的一次对还是错。

What is the total number of equally likely outcomes? Since every question has 2 possible outcomes and there are 10 questions there are a total of 210 outcomes or 1,024 possible true-false combinations. We can answer the test in 1,024 different ways. What is the number of favourable outcomes? There is only one way we can answer all 10 questions right (or wrong). They all have to be right (or wrong). The chance of getting all 10 answers right or wrong by guessing is therefore 1 in 1024. This means that if we took the test 1,024 times and guessed randomly at the answers each time, just once in 1,024 times should we expect to get all 10 answers right or wrong.

我们在 5 个问题上有多少种方法是正确的？让我们回到组合问题：如果我们可以从 10 个问题中选择，我们有多少种方法可以选择 5 个问题？有 252 种方法（101/51（10-5）！）我们可以回答 10 个问题以获得 5 分。因为每个猜测都有 50% 的概率是正确的，并且有 10 个问题，我们希望是正确的在其中的 5 个问题上，我们有 252 种同样可能的方式可以回答 5 个问题，那么我们正确回答 5 个问题的概率是 (O.5) 5 x (O.5) 5 x 252 = 24.6%

In how many ways can we be right on 5 questions? Let’s go back to combinations and ask: in how many ways can we select 5 questions if we can choose from 10 questions? There are 252 ways (101/51(10-5)!) we can answer 10 questions to get exactly a score of 5. Since each guess has a 50% probability of being right and there are 10 questions and we want to be right on exactly 5 of them and there are 252 equally likely ways we can answer 5 questions, then the probability that we answer exactly 5 questions right is (O.5)5 x (O.5)5 x 252 = 24.6%

那么我们正确回答至少 5 个问题的可能性有多大？这个概率必须更高，因为我们也可以正确回答 6、7、8、9 或 10 个问题。因此，我们必须加上我们猜对第 6、7、8、9 和 10 个问题的概率。

How likely is it then that we answer at least 5 questions correctly? This probability must be higher since we also can answer 6, 7, 8, 9 or 10 questions correct. Therefore we must add the probability that we guess 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10 questions correct.

我们在 5 个问题上有多少种方法是正确的？10！/5！（10-5）！ = 252 种方式
我们在 6 个问题上有多少种方法是正确的？10！/6！（10-6）！ = 210 种方式
我们在 7 个问题上有多少种方法是正确的？10！/7！（10-7）！ = 120 种方式
我们在 8 个问题上有多少种方法是正确的？10!/8!( 10-8)! = 45 种方式
在 9 个问题上，我们有多少种方法是正确的？10！/9！（10-9）！ = 10 种方式
有多少种方法可以正确回答问题？10！/10！（10-10）！ = 1 种方式
全部的 = 638 种方式

由于每个猜测有 50% 的概率是正确的，并且有 10 个问题，我们希望至少在其中 5 个上是正确的，并且有 638 种同样可能的方式我们可以回答至少 5 个问题，我们至少回答的概率正确的 5 个问题是 (O.5) 5 x (0.5) 5 x 638 = 62.3%。

Since each guess has a 50% probability of being right and there are 10 questions and we want to be right on at least 5 of them and there are 638 equally likely ways we can answer at least 5 questions, the probability that we answer at least 5 questions right is (O.5)5 x (0.5)5 x 638 = 62.3%.

这个例子说明了一个二项式实验。二项式实验的概率分布是：从 n 个事物中选择 k 个事物的可能方法的数量（在 n 次试验中观察到 k 次成功）x（成功概率）11（1 -成功概率）” 11

The example illustrated a binomial experiment. The probability distribution for a binomial experiment is: Number of possible ways of selecting k things from n things (observing k successes in n trials) x (probability of success)11 (1 - probability of success)"11

如果我们输入上面的数字，我们得到： 252 x (O.5) 5 x (0.5) 5 + 210 x (0.5) 6 x (0.5) 4 + 120 x (0.5) 7 x (0.5) 3 + 45 x (0.5) 8 x (0.5) 2 + 10 x (0.5)' x (0.5)' + lx (0.5)'° x (0.5)° = 62.3%

If we put in the above figures we get: 252 x (O.5)5 x (0.5)5 + 210 x (0.5)6 x (0.5)4 + 120 x (0.5)7x (0.5)3 + 45 x (0.5)8 x (0.5)2 + 10 x (0.5)’ x (0.5)’ + lx (0.5)'° x (0.5)° = 62.3%

二项式实验具有以下特征：可重复的事件或实验由 n 次相同且独立的试验组成。每次试验只有两个结果——成功/失败、正确/错误、存在/不存在、0/1 等，并且成功和失败的概率在每次试验中都是恒定的。

Binomial experiments have the following characteristics: An event that is repeatable or the experiment consists of n number of identical and independent trials. There are only two outcomes in every trial — success/failure, right/wrong, present/absent, 0/1 etc. and the probabilities of success and failure are constant in every trial.

二项式实验的例子有向目标发射弹丸（命中/未命中）、开发新药（有效/无效）、结束销售（销售/不销售）等。

Examples of binomial experiments are firing a projectile at a target (hit/miss), developing a new drug (effective/not effective), closing a sale (sale/no sale) etc.

我们将一个骰子掷 5 次。您恰好掷出 3 个六的可能性有多大？什么是成功？在一个骰子上掷出 6。一个骰子掷出 6 的概率是多少？1/6（有 6 个结果，其中一个是成功）。失败的概率是多少？1-1/6 = 5/6。试验次数是多少？5. 这些试验中成功的次数是多少？3. 在 5 次试验中，你可以用多少种方法掷出三个六（成功）？51/31（5-3）！=10^ 概率 = 10 x (l/6f x (5/6f = 3.2%

We toss a single die 5 times. How likely is it that you will roll exactly 3 sixes? What is success? Rolling a 6 on a single die. What’s the probability of rolling a 6 on a single die? 1/6 (there are 6 outcomes and one of them is a success). What is the probability of failure? 1-1/6 =5/6. What is the number of trials? 5. What is the number of successes out of those trials? 3. In how many ways can you roll three sixes (successes) in 5 trials? 51/31(5-3)! =10^ Probability = 10 x (l/6f x (5/6f = 3.2%

一艘船有三个独立的引擎，至少需要两个引擎才能正常工作。每个引擎正常工作的概率为 98%。所有三个引擎都工作的概率是 94.1% (0.98 3 )。因此，至少一台发动机（发动机 1、2 或 3）发生故障的概率为 5.9%（这与恰好 1 台发动机发生故障 + 恰好 2 台发动机发生故障 + 恰好 3 台发动机发生故障的概率相同）。

A boat has three independent engines and needs at least two to work properly. The probability that each engine works properly is 98%. The probability that all three engines work is 94.1% (0.983). The probability that at least one engine fails (either engine 1, 2 or 3) is therefore 5.9% (this is the same as the probability that exactly 1 engine fail + exactly 2 engines fails + exactly 3 engines fails).

至少有 2 个引擎工作的概率是多少？让我们回到组合和二项分布：概率（3 个引擎工作）+ 概率（2 个引擎工作）= 31/31(3-3)1 x (0.98fx (0.02)° + 31/21(3-2) 1 x (0.98fx (0.02)' = 99.8816%。因此，至少有两个引擎发生故障的概率为 0.1184%。船将在 845 次中有 1 次无法工作。

What is the probability that at least 2 engines work? Let’s go back to combinations and the binomial distribution: probability (3 engines work) + probability (2 engines work) = 31/31(3-3)1 x (0.98f x (0.02)° + 31/21(3-2)1 x (0.98f x (0.02)‘ = 99.8816%. The probability that at least two engines will fail is therefore 0.1184%. The boat will fail to work in 1 out of 845 times.

让我们添加一个备份引擎。现在至少有 2 个引擎工作的概率是多少？概率（4 个引擎工作）+ 概率（3 个引擎工作）+ 概率（2 个引擎工作）= 41/41(4-4)1 x (0.98fx (0.02f + x (o.98f x (0.02)' + 41 /21(4-2)1 x (0.98fx (0.02f = 99.996848%)。因此，至少三个引擎发生故障的概率为 0.003152%。这艘船现在只有 31,726 次中的 1 次发生故障。

Let’s add a backup engine. What is now the probability that at least 2 engines work? Probability (4 engines work) + probability (3 engines work) + probability (2 engines work) = 41/41(4-4)1 x (0.98f x (0.02f + x (o.98f x (0.02)' + 41/21(4-2)1 x (0.98f x (0.02f = 99.996848%. The probability that at least three engines will fail is therefore 0.003152%. The boat will now only fail in 1 out of 31,726 times.

二项式概率假设独立。可能是一台发动机的故障增加了第二台发动机的故障概率。例如，一台发动机的故障会增加第二台发动机运行的负载。使用一台发动机会对第二台发动机造成更大的压力和磨损，等等。

Binomial probabilities assume independence. It may be that the failure of one engine increases the failure probability of a second engine. For example, the failure of one engine increases the load on which the second engine is run. Using one engine causes more stress and wear to the second engine, etc.

一些例子的计算

Calculations to some of the examples

页

Page

  • 150 我们可以从 49 个数字中选择 6 个数字的可能方式是 491/(49-6)16！= 13,983,816。

    24 小时等于 1,440 分钟。一年 365 天等于 525,600 分钟。1400 万分钟约等于 27 年。

  • 150 The possible number of ways we can choose 6 numbers out of 49 are 491/(49-6)16! = 13,983,816.

    24 hours equals 1,440 minutes. One 365-day year equals 525,600 minutes. 14 million minutes equals about 27 years.

  • 159 我们成功的概率是 (0.8) 6或 26%。

  • 159 The probability we succeed is (0.8)6 or 26%.

  • 160 10 家相互独立的初创企业全部成功的概率为 0.01% (0.4 10 )，但至少有一家成功的概率为 99.4% (1 - 0.6 10 )。

  • 160 The probability that 10 mutually independent start-ups all succeed is 0.01% (0.410) but the probability that at least one succeeds is 99.4% (1 - 0.610).

  • 161 至少有一个部件不工作的概率为 86.5% (1 — 0.999 2000 )。假设是独立的，系统失效的概率（至少有一个部分必须失效，系统才会失效）是 1 减去系统的可靠性。

  • 161 The probability that at least one of the parts don’t work is 86.5% (1 — 0.9992000). Assuming independence, the probability of system failure (where at least one part must fail for the system to fail) is 1 minus the reliability of the system.

  • 161 假设独立，系统故障的概率（两个导航系统都必须故障才能使系统故障）是主系统和备用系统故障概率的乘积。

  • 161 Assuming independence, the probability of system failure (where both navigation systems must fail for the system to fail) is the product of the probabilities of primary and back up system failing.

  • 162 在任何给定年份有二十分之一机会发生的事件几乎肯定会在 50 年内发生 (1 - O.95 50 = 92.3%)。如果某个事件在任何给定年份发生的可能性为 5%，那么它不会发生的可能性为 95%。它在 50 年内不会发生的可能性是 7.7%。这意味着该事件至少发生一次的概率为 92.3%。

  • 162 An event that has one chance in 20 of happening in any given year is nearly certain to happen over 50 years (1 - O.9550 = 92.3%). If there is a 5% chance that an event happens in any given year, then the chance that it won’t happen is 95%. The chance that it won’t happen over 50 years is 7.7%. This means that the probability that the event happens at least once is 92.3%.

  • 162 在任何给定年份至少发生一次事故的概率为 3.9% (1 -0.999 40 )。在未来 10 年内至少发生一次事故的概率为 33% (1 - 0.961 10 )。

  • 162 The probability that at least one accident will happen in any given year is 3.9% (1 -0.99940). The probability that at least one accident will happen during the next 10 years is 33% (1 - 0.96110).

  • 162 因此，任何给定年份（假设为常数）发生大地震的概率为 3.2% ((1 -p) 30 = 38%)。未来 5 年内至少发生一次大地震的概率为 15% (1 - 0.968 5 )。

  • 162 The probability of a major earthquake happening in any given year (assumed to be a constant) is therefore 3.2% ((1 -p)30 = 38%). The probability that a major earthquake will happen at least once during the next 5 years is 15% (1 - 0.9685).

  • 165 在一组 1,048,576 (2 20 ) 人中，它发生在某人身上。事实上，在拥有 2.8 亿人口的美国，百万分之一的偶然事件每天发生 280 次（1/1,000,000 x 2.8 亿）。

  • 165 In a group of 1,048,576 (220) people it happens to someone. In fact, in the U.S. a country with 280 million people, one in a million chance events happen 280 times a day (1/1,000,000 x 280 million).

  • 165 如果我们假设有 365 天可供选择并且所有生日发生的可能性相同，则 1 个人有 365 种可能的生日。当一组中有 2 个人时，第二个人可以在 364 个可能的生日中进行选择，这些生日不与第一个人共享。第二个人只与第一个人共享 1 天。因此，两个人生日相同的机会是 365 分之一或 0.27%。当一组中有 3 个人时，通过首先找出这 3 个人中没有人生日相同的可能性有多大，可以更容易地找到其中 2 个人生日相同的可能性。当一组有 3 个人时，第三个人可以在 363 个可能的生日中进行选择，这些生日不会与前两个人中的任何一个共享。

    为了找到多个事件发生的概率，我们将各个概率相乘。因此，3 人一组中没有人生日相同的概率为：365/365 x 364/365 x 363/365 = 99.18%。因此，一组 3 个人中有 2 个人生日相同的概率是 1 - 0.9918 或 0.82%。让我们对一组 23 人重复此过程：

    365 x 364 x 363 x......343 = 49.3%。

    365 23

    因此，一组 23 个人中有 2 个人生日相同的概率为 1 - 0.493 或 50.7%。

  • 165 1 person has 365 possible birthdays if we assume that there are 365 days to choose from and that all birthdays are equally likely to happen. When there are 2 persons in a group the second person can choose among 364 possible birthdays that are not shared with the first person. The second person only shares 1 day with the first person. The chance that 2 persons share birthdays is therefore 1 out of 365 or 0.27%. When there are 3 people in a group it is easier to find the likelihood that 2 of them share a birthday by first finding out how likely it is that no one of these 3 people share birthdays. When there are 3 people in a group the third person can choose among 363 possible birthdays that are not shared with any of the first 2 persons. This means that the chance that the third person will not share birthday with any of the first 2 persons is 363 out of 365 or 99.45%.

    To find the probability that multiple events happen, we multiply the individual probabilities together. The probability that no one in a group of 3, share birthday is therefore: 365/365 x 364/365 x 363/365 = 99.18%. Therefore, the probability that 2 people in a group of 3 share birthdays is 1 — 0.9918 or 0.82%. Let’s repeat this procedure for a group of 23 people:

    365 x 364 x 363 x......343 = 49.3%.

     36523

    Therefore, the probability that 2 people in a group of 23, share birthdays is 1 - 0.493 or 50.7%.

  • 178 在 10 次预测结束时，一只猴子在预测利率方向方面拥有完美记录 (1,000 x 0.5 10 )。

  • 178 At the end of 10 predictions, one monkey has a perfect record of predicting the direction of interest rates (1,000 x 0.510).

  • 180 在10次试验中获得2次成功的方法数为10!/ (10-2)!2! 或 45。概率为 45x (0.8) 2 x (0.2) 8或 0.007%。

  • 180 The number of ways to get 2 successes in 10 trials are 10!/ (10-2)!2! or 45. The probability is 45x (0.8)2 x (0.2)8 or 0.007%.

附录四：检查表

Appendix Four: check-lists

有助于实现目标、做出选择、解决问题、评估可能是对还是错等。

Helpful for achieving goals, making choices, solving problems, evaluating what is likely to be true or false etc.

使用概念

Use notions

  • 使用构成现实基础的重要想法
  • Use the big ideas that underlie reality
  • 理解某事的真正含义
  • Understand what something really means
  • 简化
  • Simplify
  • 使用规则和过滤器
  • Use rules and filters
  • 知道我想要达到什么
  • Know what I want to achieve
  • 查找和评估备选方案
  • Find and evaluate alternatives
  • 从整体上了解后果及其后果
  • Understand consequences and their consequences on the whole
  • 量化
  • Quantify
  • 搜索并以证据为基础
  • Search for and base things on evidence
  • 逆向思考
  • Think things through backward
  • 请记住，大的影响来自大量的因素组合
  • Remember that big effects come from large combinations of factors
  • 如果我错了，请评估后果
  • Evaluate the consequences if I’m wrong

问题是什么？

What is the issue?

  • 问题是什么？这到底是怎么回事？
  • What’s the question? What is this really about?
  • 问题的本质或要点是什么？那么关键问题是什么？
  • What’s the essence or nub of the issue? What is then the key question?
  • 相关的？可解？重要的？可知？实用性？
  • Relevant? Solvable? Important? Knowable? Utility applicability?
  • 我了解主题的全部内容吗？为了对某个主题发表意见，我需要一些相关数据和关于该主题的基本知识，否则就说：“我不知道”。
  • Do I understand what the subject is all about? In order to have an opinion on a subject I need some relevant data and basic knowledge about the subject, otherwise just say:"I don’t know".
  • 我这里的判断是不是比别人好？
  • Is my judgement here better than others?
  • 我必须在这里预测什么，它是可预测的吗？
  • What must I predict here and is it predictable?
  • 需要做决定吗？如果我不处理这件事会怎样？这是我无能为力的事吗？“我”应该这样做吗？
  • Is a decision needed? What happens if I don’t deal with this? Is this something I can do anything about? Should"I" do this?
  • 我在多长时间内考虑这个问题？我现在在哪里？从谁的角度来看？
  • Over what period of time am I considering this issue? Where am I at present? From whose point of view?
  • 通过首先决定大的“无需思考的问题”来简化并从我所在的地方开始。
  • Simplify by deciding big"no-brainer questions" first and begin from where I am.

明白这意味着什么

Understand what it means

  • 用我理解的术语翻译单词和想法。我是否理解词语和陈述的真正含义和暗示？这意味着什么吗？它会帮助我对可能发生的事情做出有用的预测吗？
  • Translate words and ideas in terms I understand. Do I understand what words and statements really mean and imply? Does it mean anything? Will it help me make useful predictions on what is likely to happen?

过滤器和规则

Filters and Rules

  • 使用过滤器英寸规则和默认规则我可以​​进行哪些测试？
  • Use filters inch rules and default rules what test(s) can I make?
  • 适应我的心理性质、能力、优势和局限性
  • Adapt to my psychological nature, abilities, advantages, and limitations
  • 考虑价值观和偏好，因此考虑优先事项和我想避免的事情
  • Consider values and preferences and therefore priorities and what I want to avoid

我具体和可衡量的想要实现和避免什么以及何时以及为什么？

What do I specifically and measurable want to achieve and avoid and when and why?

  • 我想实现什么样的未来“价值”？目标数字？目标效应？时间范围？
  • What future"value" do I want to achieve? Target numbers? Target effects? Time horizon?
  • 假设我已经达到了我的目标。这在数量和效果上意味着什么？那么必须取得什么成就呢？它（目标）是否合理？如果我把这个倒过来到现在合理吗？
  • Assume I have already reached my target. What would this imply in numbers and effects? What must then have been achieved? Is it (target) reasonable? Is it reasonable if I reverse this to the present?
  • 我是否有办法衡量目标的实现程度？衡量标准的关键变量或组成部分？
  • Do I have ways to measure to what degree my goal is being achieved? Key variables or components of yardstick?
  • 如果我实现了这一点，会发生什么？我希望这种情况发生吗？
  • If I achieve this what will happen? Do I want that to happen?
  • 我可以把我的目标分解成有期限的短期目标吗？
  • Can I break my goal into short-term goals with deadlines?
  • 我这样做的真正原因是什么？是因为我想还是因为我必须？我是否从内部和外部现实陈述了我的目标，或者我现在有偏见或受到某些心理力量的影响？
  • What is my real reason for doing this? Is it because I want to or because I have to? Have I stated my goal from internal and external realities or am I biased now or influenced by some psychological forces?
  • 我能否以一种更容易理解如何实现目标的方式来表达我的目标？
  • Can I express my goal in a way that makes it easier to see how it is going to be achieved?
  • 这是我想要实现的真正目标吗？
  • Is this the true goal for what I want to achieve?

那是什么原因呢？

What is the cause of that?

  • 为了实现我的目标，我必须了解实现我的目标的原因
  • To achieve my goal I must understand what causes my goal to be achieved
  • 目标的等式是什么？我有什么证据？
  • What is the equation for goal and what evidence do I have for that?
  • 我不想达到什么目的？是什么导致了非目标，我该怎么做才能避免这种情况？我不能做什么或必须避免什么？
  • What don’t I want to achieve? What causes non-goal and what can I do to avoid that? What must I not do or what must I avoid?
  • 哪些变量会影响系统？决定主要结果的关键力量和变量是什么？未知的关键是什么？我可以评估、优化……不同变量的确定性如何？
  • What variables influence the system? What are the critical forces and variables, the ones that account for the main outcome? What is the key unknown? What is the certainty with which I can evaluate, optimize ... the different variables?
  • 哪些变量依赖于其他变量（或情况、环境、背景、时间、行为），哪些变量相互独立？
  • Which variables are dependent on other variables (or situation, environment, context, timing, behaviour) and which ones act independently of each other?
  • 是什么力量导致变量得以实现？什么产生力？有短期和长期的力量吗？他们的相对实力如何？它们如何结合和相互作用，有什么影响？怎样才能让多股力量向同一个方向共同行动？什么缺乏力量会破坏这个系统？是什么产生了这种力量？它们的可预测性如何？现有的力量可以理性地预期会导致什么？哪些力量是暂时的，哪些是永久的？当作用于变量的力发生变化时，系统将如何变化？
  • What force causes a variable to be achieved? What produces the force(s)? Are there short-and long-term forces? What is their relative strength? How do they combine and interact and what are the effects? How can I get many forces to operate together in the same direction? What lack of force would destroy the system? What produces this force? How predictable are they? What can the forces in place rationally expect to cause? What forces are temporary and which ones are permanent? How will the system change as the forces that act on the variable change?
  • 系统对变量和/或力变化的抵抗力如何？规模、大小或质量、强度、强度、长度、时间范围、环境、参与者等的变化（上/下）的可能想要和不想要的短期和长期后果（在数量和影响上）是什么？— 在变量或力中？当许多小原因长期运作时会发生什么？如果一个力长期作用于变量会产生什么后果？哪一种力量可以改变它？创造一个临界质量需要什么？添加什么力可以产生临界质量？如何？当我更改变量或力时会发生其他事情吗？力量改变必须发生什么？更改是否会产生其他后果（请注意，我感兴趣的是对整个系统的影响和最终结果）？一个变量的变化是否会对结果产生显着影响？属性也会改变吗？如果变量之间的关系发生变化，会有什么后果？什么是变化点？壁垒？催化剂？引爆点？拐点？断点？限制？效果发生之前是否存在时间滞后？反馈？什么可以加速事业？当效果逆转时，关键点是什么？我可以改变等式中的什么，其他人可以改变什么？如何？WHO？什么时候？我必须更改哪些变量才能实现目标？我如何衡量变化量？如果我改变假设，敏感度如何？对目标和路径的影响？如果我保持一个变量不变会发生什么？如果我同时增加一个变量并减少另一个变量？净效应？如果我一次改变一个变量或力？环境中有什么可以改变这种情况？如果我优化其中一个变量，我还能获得哪些其他优势和劣势？必须发生什么才能导致结果发生变化？如果我改变条件，它仍然是一个变量吗？等式以及其他人可以改变什么？如何？WHO？什么时候？我必须更改哪些变量才能实现目标？我如何衡量变化量？如果我改变假设，敏感度如何？对目标和路径的影响？如果我保持一个变量不变会发生什么？如果我同时增加一个变量并减少另一个变量？净效应？如果我一次改变一个变量或力？环境中有什么可以改变这种情况？如果我优化其中一个变量，我还能获得哪些其他优势和劣势？必须发生什么才能导致结果发生变化？如果我改变条件，它仍然是一个变量吗？等式以及其他人可以改变什么？如何？WHO？什么时候？我必须更改哪些变量才能实现目标？我如何衡量变化量？如果我改变假设，敏感度如何？对目标和路径的影响？如果我保持一个变量不变会发生什么？如果我同时增加一个变量并减少另一个变量？净效应？如果我一次改变一个变量或力？环境中有什么可以改变这种情况？如果我优化其中一个变量，我还能获得哪些其他优势和劣势？必须发生什么才能导致结果发生变化？如果我改变条件，它仍然是一个变量吗？小路？如果我保持一个变量不变会发生什么？如果我同时增加一个变量并减少另一个变量？净效应？如果我一次改变一个变量或力？环境中有什么可以改变这种情况？如果我优化其中一个变量，我还能获得哪些其他优势和劣势？必须发生什么才能导致结果发生变化？如果我改变条件，它仍然是一个变量吗？小路？如果我保持一个变量不变会发生什么？如果我同时增加一个变量并减少另一个变量？净效应？如果我一次改变一个变量或力？环境中有什么可以改变这种情况？如果我优化其中一个变量，我还能获得哪些其他优势和劣势？必须发生什么才能导致结果发生变化？如果我改变条件，它仍然是一个变量吗？
  • How resistant is the system to a change in the variables and/or forces? What are the likely wanted and unwanted shortand long-term consequences (on numbers and effects) of changes (up/down) scale, size or mass, strength, intensity, length, time horizon, environment, participants etc. — in the variables or forces? What happens when a number of small causes operate over a long time? What are the consequences if a force acts on the variable over a long time? Which force could change it? What is needed to create a critical mass? What forces when added can create a critical mass? How? Will something else happen when I change a variable or force? What must happen for a force to change? Can a change produce other consequences (observe that I am interested in effects on the whole system and the final outcome)? Does a change in one variable make a dramatic difference in outcome? Will the properties also change? What are the consequences if the relation between the variables changes? What is the change point? Barriers? Catalyst? Tipping point? Inflection point? Break point? Limits? Is there a time lag before effects happen? Feedback? What can speed up the cause? What are the critical points when the effects get reversed? What can I change in the equation and what can others change? How? Who? When? Which variables must I change to achieve goal? How can I measure the amount of change? Degree of sensitivity if I change the assumptions? Effects on goal and path? What will happen if I hold one variable constant? If I at the same time increase one variable and decrease another? Net effect? If I change one variable or force at a time? What is it in the environment that can change the situation? What other advantages and disadvantages can I achieve if I optimize one of the variables? What must happen to cause a change in outcome? Is it still a variable if I change the conditions?
  • 等式是否有例外？为什么？达到目标需要什么条件？我的目标有短期和长期的不同吗？原因是时间依赖性的吗？我可以通过观察结果来推断原因吗？我是否从不同的角度和观点看待这个系统？主体的测量取决于什么？
  • Are there exceptions to the equation and why? What conditions are required to achieve goal? Has my goal different cause short-term and long-term? Is the cause time-dependent? Can I deduce the cause by observing the effects? Have I looked upon the system from different angles and viewpoints? What does the measurement of the subject depend on?
  • 限制目标实现的主要制约因素是什么？
  • What is the major constraint that limits the goal from being achieved?

我有哪些可用的替代方案来实现我的目标？

What available alternatives do I have to achieve my goal?

  • 根据目标、所讨论的主题、规则和过滤器、因果关系、人类行为、证据、反证据、简单性和金钱、时间、其他资源、努力、理解、风险和精神压力的机会成本来判断备选方案。
  • Judge alternatives in terms of goal, subject in question, rules and filters, cause and effect, human behaviour, evidence, counter evidence, simplicity and opportunity cost of money, time, other resources, effort, understanding, risk and mental stress.
  • 我有哪些证据（英寸模型）表明这些备选方案最有可能实现目标？
  • What evidence (inch models) do I have that these alternatives are most likely to achieve goal?
  • 它们取决于时间范围或事件吗？
  • Are they depending on time horizon or event?
  • 每项行动的可能后果是什么？会发生什么可能的结果？可能性？每个结果有多可取？
  • What are the likely consequences of each action? What possible outcomes can happen? Likelihood? How desirable is each consequence?
  • 如果我现在采取特定行动，我是否会放弃任何未来的机会？
  • Do I forego any future opportunities if I make a specific action now?

后果是什么？

What are the consequences?

  • 通过估计可能的后果找出最有可能实现我的目标的备选方案
  • Find out which alternative are most likely to achieve my goal by estimating their likely consequences
  • 如果我这样做，会发生什么？为什么这不会发生？
  • If I do this, what will happen? Why will this not happen?
  • 考虑相关变量的每个备选/事件（命题）可能（逻辑上）想要的和不想要的（或意外的）后果（定量和定性）以及后果的后果（即时和长期）是什么？
  • What are the likely (logical) wanted and unwanted (or unintended) consequences (quantitative and qualitative) and consequences of consequences (immediate and over the course of a long period) of each alternative/event (proposition) factoring in relevant variables?
  • 可能发生的不同情况和结果是什么？根据证据，短期和长期可能发生什么？
  • What are the different scenarios and outcomes that can happen? What is likely to happen short and long-term based on the evidence?
  • 什么可以帮助我预测后果或某件事可能是真还是假？
  • What can help me make predictions on consequences or if something is likely to be true or false?
  • 要实现目标必须发生什么？必要事件发生并发生在我身上的可能性有多大？概率有利于什么？如果我推翻这个命题会怎样？
  • What must happen for the goal to be achieved? How likely is it that the necessary events will happen and happen to me? What does the probabilities favour? What will happen if I reverse the proposition?
  • 可以显着影响结果的不确定性有哪些？由于重复效应、并发症……会产生哪些意想不到的后果？净效应是正的吗？后果是否预示着其他任何事情？这还有什么意思？
  • What are the uncertainties that can significantly influence the outcome? What unintended consequences are there due to repeating effects, complications... ? Is the net effect positive? Does the consequences predict anything else? What else does this mean?
  • 如果这是真的或假的，后果是什么？
  • What are the consequences if this is true or false?
  • 我是否从不同的角度考虑了整个系统？我是否考虑过社会、经济、身体和情感方面的后果？其他人可能会做什么？我对早期行为的体验是什么？当其他人也这样做时会发生什么？
  • Have I considered the whole system from different viewpoints? Have I considered social, financial, physical and emotional consequences? What are others likely to do? What are my experiences of earlier behaviour? What happens when others do the same?

偏见

Bias

  • 是否有因利己主义或心理影响而产生偏见而导致误判的原因？
  • Is there any reason for bias due to self-interest or psychological influences that may cause misjudgement?
  • 这是有偏见的说法还是事实？什么是事实判断，什么是价值判断？
  • Is this a biased statement or a fact? What are factual judgements and what are value judgements?
  • 他有多可靠？他有资格判断吗？证书？他这样做的目的是什么？他有撒谎的动机吗？他怎么知道这是真的？
  • How reliable is he? Is he competent enough to judge? Credentials? What is his purpose with this? Does he have any motive to lie? How does he know that this is true?

假设

The hypothesis

  • 基于我想要达到的目标；测试目标隐含的陈述或后果陈述。
  • Based on what I want to achieve; test statement implied by goal or statement for consequences.
  • 对于每个备选方案，请问：这个备选方案是否可能实现我的目标（正确）？对于命题，问：这个命题可能为真吗？
  • For every alternative ask: Is this alternative likely to achieve my goal (true) ? For proposition ask: Is this proposition likely to be true?
  • 如果这是真的，我如何测试（可测试性）？在我尝试查看它是否为真之前，我可以尝试证明它是假的吗？
  • How can I test (testability) if this is true? Can I try to prove it is false before I try to see if it’s true?
  • 如果我要测试这个陈述，我需要知道什么？我必须首先找出导致陈述为真的方程式，这样我才能知道我需要知道未来真实结果的最重要因素是什么，然后寻找支持和反对这将实现的证据。需要证明的命题是什么？
  • What do I need to know if I shall test this statement? I must first find out the equation for what causes the statement to be true so I know what is the most important I need to know the future true outcome of and then search for the evidence for and against that this will be achieved. What is the statement that should be proved?
  • 最简单的假设是什么？
  • What is the simplest hypothesis?

寻找证据并判断证据

Look for evidence and judge the evidence

  • 实现关键原因（目标、非目标和命题）的可能性有多大？
  • How likely is it that the key cause (for goal, non-goal, and proposition) will be achieved?
  • 在评估陈述或真/假时，寻找意义、动机、原因、后果以及支持和反对的证据。
  • When evaluating statements or true/false, look for meaning, motives, causes, consequences and evidence for and against.
  • 如果这是真的，那么后果会是什么？它不是真的不合逻辑或令人难以置信的后果吗？它有任何预见性吗？
  • If this were true what would the consequences then imply? Are the consequences of it not being true illogical or unbelievable? Does it have any predictability?
  • 如果这是真的，我如何以及在哪里可以找到有代表性的证据？给出了什么？什么是不容置疑的真理？测试或其他测量方法在重复时是否会给出相同的结果（可靠）？我可以测试后果（可验证）吗？证据是否基于已知的，我对数据的解释是否正确（有效）？我有什么证据？反对的证据？我有什么理由接受该证据？证据权重？证据的质量如何？证据的可信度如何？取决于时间、环境？样本太小？该陈述是否与现有证据一致？它是否违反任何科学规律或自然规律？
  • How and where can I find the representative evidence if this is true? What is given? What are unquestionable truths? Will the test or other ways of measure give the same results when repeated (reliable)? Can I test for consequences (verifiable)? Is the evidence based on what is known and have I interpreted the data correct (valid) ? What evidence do I have? Evidence against? What grounds do I have for accepting that evidence? Weight of evidence? What is the quality of the evidence? How credible is the evidence? Dependent on time, environment? Too small sample? Does the statement agree with the available evidence? Does it violate any scientific laws or laws of nature?
  • 我有哪些代表性信息？通过观察发生了什么？我可以做一个实验来证实我的猜测吗？与实验相符吗？
  • What representative information do I have? What is happening by observation? Can I do an experiment to confirm my guess? Does it agree with experiment?
  • 关于过去发生的事情（成功与否）的跟踪记录（案件发生率、基本发生率频率、可变性、平均发生率、随机性程度、我自己的经验、环境、参与者以及案件的其他相关因素）是什么？有什么理由相信这个记录不能代表未来可能发生的事情？什么能让未来与过去大不相同？什么是永久的，什么不是？
  • What is the track record (case rate, base rate frequency, variability, average rate, degree of randomness, my own experiences, environment, players, and other relevant factors for the case) on what happened (worked and not) in the past? Is there any reason to believe that this record isn’t representative for what is likely to happen in the future? What can make the future a lot different than the past? What’s been permanent and what hasn’t?
  • 这种情况还能持续多久？现在的主要原因是什么？什么力量可以让它继续、开始改变或停止它，为什么？有可能吗？
  • How long can this continue? What is the major cause(s) now? What force(s) can make it continue, initiate a change, or stop it and why? Is it likely?
  • 如果我得到的证据与我以前的信念相反，我必须问：这是怎么发生的？这里发生了什么？我有什么证据？我有什么理由接受这些证据？
  • If I get evidence that is the opposite of my previous convictions I must ask: How does this happen? What is going on here? What evidence do I have? What grounds do I have for accepting the evidence?

像检察官一样思考来反驳我（或其他人）的结论

Disprove my (or others) conclusion by thinking like a prosecutor

  • 考虑误判的原因
  • Consider causes for misjudgements
  • 如何检验和证明我的想法和结论是错误的？我可能错了的原因是什么？我在哪里可以找到表明我错了的证据？我的证据可信度如何？哪些事实和证据不同意我的结论/想法？
  • How can I test and prove that my idea and conclusion is wrong? What reasons are there why I might be wrong? Where can I find the evidence that suggest I am wrong? How credible is my evidence? What facts and evidence disagree with my conclusion/idea?
  • 我建立案例的主要假设是什么？它们是建立在现实之上的吗？他们的后果合乎逻辑吗？有没有人证明我的假设是正确的？如果我的信念和假设是错误的，会有什么后果？
  • What major assumptions have I built the case on? Are they built on reality? Are their consequences logical? Has anyone proved that my assumptions are right? What are the consequences if my beliefs and assumptions are wrong?
  • 我忽略或忽略了什么？更好的选择？我忽略了证据吗？当涉及到人类时，我是否考虑了限制？哪些因素是不确定的，为什么？我只是预测了当前的趋势吗？我误解了什么？我使用了正确的定义吗？我是否考虑并结合了所有相关因素？我是否使用了适当的衡量标准？我测量错了吗？我混淆了原因和相关性吗？如果我的目标是由我认为正确但事实并非如此的东西决定的怎么办？是否存在随机或系统错误？还有哪些其他原因可以解释我的结果？我是否考虑过整个系统以及相互作用的部分有时会以意想不到和不需要的方式变化？
  • What have I ignored or overlooked? Better alternatives? Have I ignored evidence? Have I taken into account the limitations when humans are involved? What factors are uncertain and why? Have I just projected present trends? What have I misinterpreted? Have I used the right definitions? Did I consider and combined all the relevant factors? Have I used the appropriate measure/yardstick? Did I go wrong in the measurement? Have I confused cause and correlation? What about if my goal is shaped by what I believe is true but it isn’t? Are there random or systematic errors? What other causes can explain my results? Have I considered the whole system and that interacting parts sometimes can vary in unexpected and unwanted ways?
  • 偏向于我自己的想法？我的自我妨碍了我做出明智的决定吗？我真的会打破历史平均水平/记录吗？我有没有寻找相反的效果？
  • Bias for my own ideas? Is my ego getting in the way of making an intelligent decision? Will I really beat the historical average/record? Have I looked for contrary effects?
  • 我没看到什么？这有什么意义呢？假设的倒置会导致逻辑荒谬吗？相反的可能性更大吗？有没有相反的证据？有什么证据可以证明它是假的（或没有达到目标）？有哪些实验（或经验、观察……）证据表明它是错误的？更多支持这一点的证据？是什么导致它是假的？
  • What do I not see? What is the significance of this? Does an inversion of the assumption lead to a logical absurdity? Is the opposite more likely? Is there any contrary evidence? What evidence can prove it is false (or not achieving goal)? What experimental (or experience, observation...) evidence are there that it’s false? More evidence in favour of that? What causes it to be false?
  • 意义？我可以证明它是真实的后果令人难以置信吗？如果我用数学方法追溯它，隐含的效果是什么？与声明相反的可能性更大吗？如果是，则该命题可能是错误的。
  • Meaning? Can I show that the consequences of it being true are unbelievable? What is the implied effect if I trace it out mathematically? Would the opposite of the statement be more likely? If yes, the proposition is probably false.

缺点是什么？

What is the downside?

  • 我怎么会受伤？什么可能出错？什么可以把它变成一个错误？会有什么后果？
  • How can I be hurt? What could possible go wrong? What can turn this into a mistake? What would the consequences be?
  • 事情出错的频率是多少？意外因素？会发生什么会极大地改变结果？
  • How often do things go wrong? Surprise factors? What can happen that will dramatically change the outcome?
  • 噩梦场景中可能发生的最糟糕的事情是什么？那有多大可能？如果它发生了，我该怎么办？如果事情变得更糟，会有什么后果？那么后果是什么？
  • What is the worst thing that could happen the nightmare scenario? How likely is that? What will I do if it does? What are the consequences if things go from bad to worse? And what are then the consequences?
  • 如果两三个力量联合起来对付我，后果会怎样？哪些备选方案的净效应最差？
  • What are the consequences if I get two or three forces acting in concert against me? Which alternatives net effects are least worse?
  • 执行风险？
  • Execution risk?
  • 我最不喜欢什么？我最不确定的是什么？
  • What do I least like? What am I least sure of?
  • 优势会给我带来不必要的后果吗？我如何失去优势？
  • Can an advantage give me unwanted consequences? How do I lose an advantage?
  • 我怎样才能构建“系统”以最小化负面影响？我不希望发生的事情的解毒剂？我有应对意外的备用计划吗？我可以更正吗？我可以设置什么规则来实现目标并避免非目标？是否有内置的安全系数？
  • How can I structure the"system" to minimize the influence of negatives? Antidotes to what I don’t want happen? Do I have a backup plan for surprises? Can I correct it? What rules can I install to achieve goal and avoid non-goal? Is there a built-in safety factor?

如果我错了会有什么后果？

What are the consequences if I am wrong?

  • 我赌的关键是什么？我是否会为了一些对我来说效用相对较低的东西而冒对我重要的事情的风险？
  • What key thing am I betting on? Do I risk what is important for me for something of relative low utility for me?
  • 与下一个最佳机会相比，错误加权的成本（美元、时间、精神压力等）与正确的收益或价值相比是多少？
  • What is the cost (dollars, time, mental stress etc) of being wrong weighted against the benefit or value of being right compared to the next best available opportunity?
  • 如果我这样做是因为我相信后果符合我的最大利益/这是真的但我错了/这是错误的，那么我的目标的短期和长期后果（实际损失和机会成本损失）是什么，我可以处理吗他们和/或扭转他们？
  • If I do this because I believe the consequences are in my best interest/it’s true but I turn out wrong/it is false, what are the shortand long-term consequences (actual loss and opportunity cost loss) for my goal and can I handle them and/or reverse them?
  • 如果我不这样做是因为我认为后果不符合我的最大利益/这是错误的但我证明是错误的/这是真的，那么我的目标的短期和长期后果是什么，我可以处理它们和/或逆转他们？
  • If I don’t do this because I believe the consequences is not in my best interest/it’s false but I turn out wrong/it’s true, what are the shortand long-term consequences for my goal and can I handle them and/or reverse them?
  • 如果我现在根本不做决定是因为我认为没有必要但我错了，那么对我的目标的短期和长期后果是什么，我可以处理和/或扭转它们吗？
  • If I don’t take a decision at all now because I don’t believe it is necessary but I am wrong, what are the shortand long-term consequences for my goal and can I handle them and/or reverse them?

价值是多少？

What is the value?

  • 这些替代方案中的每一个对我有什么用处或偏好？哪种选择最有可能实现我的目标和最终目标？它真的比我的其他选择更有吸引力吗？
  • What is the utility or preference of each of these alternatives to me? Which alternative is most likely to achieve my goal and ultimate objective? Is it really more attractive than the other choices I have?
  • 我可以使用什么作为标准来相互判断我的备选方案？
  • What can I use as criteria to judge my alternatives against each other?
  • 如果我通过分配特征数值来权衡备选方案，我最喜欢什么？
  • What do I like best if I weigh the alternatives against each other by assigning their characteristics numerical values?
  • 它会有所作为吗？产生影响？我有多愿意接受某些结果？
  • Will it make a difference? Make an impact? How willing am I to accept certain outcomes?

什么标准可以用来衡量进步或衡量事物？

What yardstick can be used to measure progress or to measure things against?

  • 我使用什么标准？做出决定的标准是什么？
  • What yardstick(s) do I use? What is the yardstick by which the decision is made?
  • 我怎样才能轻松衡量目标的实现程度？我可以跟踪哪些指标？
  • How can I easily measure to what degree my goal are being achieved? What indicators can I track?
  • “系统”是否会激励人们以某种​​方式行事以实现我的目标？或者它是否违背了目标？
  • Does the"system" give people an incentive to behave in a way so that my goal will be achieved? Or does it work against the goal?

现在如何行动？

How act now?

  • 我可以执行吗？我现在必须（必须）做哪些具体行动？我需要先做什么？
  • Can I execute? What specific action (s) do I have to do (must do) now? What do I need to do first?
  • 谁将做什么、在哪里、何时、为什么以及如何做？
  • Who is going to do what, where, when, why and how?
  • 我是否决定了关键点（时间和效果）在哪里？
  • Have I decided on where the critical points (time and effects) are?
  • 我是否安装了某种控制站和规则？为什么这是正确的规则？如果我不安装此规则（或改变我做某事的方式）会有什么后果？根据规则，我必须采取哪些行政和实际行动？遵守规则需要多少时间？我可以控制遵守规则的方式吗？我可以安装限时规则吗？规则在哪里不起作用？
  • Have I installed some kind of control stations and rules? Why is this the right rule? What are the consequences if I don’t install this rule (or change my way of doing something)? What administrative and practical actions must I do due to the rule? How much time will it take to follow the rule? Can I control how I follow the rule? Can I install a time-limited rule? Where does the rules not work?

我做出了积极的决定吗？

Have I made an active decision?

  • 我是否准备好改变决定，以反映新信息或新见解，了解哪些有效，哪些无效？
  • Am I prepared to change the decision to reflect new information or new insights on what works and not?
  • 另一个决定是否取决于特定事件的发生？我是否评估了目前存在的问题？该决定的基本原理是否仍然存在？有什么新的证据可以改变可能性？我衡量进展的方式是否提供了未来可能发生的事情的任何线索？事件——相关还是无关？它对我的目标有什么影响（与时间范围无关）？
  • Is another decision contingent on a specific event happening? Have I evaluated the issue as it exists today? Is the underlying rationale for the decision still there? What new evidence is there that can change the likelihood? Does my way of measuring progress give any clue of what is likely to happen in the future? Events — relevant or irrelevant? Does it make any difference for my goal (independent of time horizon)?

事后分析或从错误中吸取教训

Post mortem or learning from mistakes

  • 效果如何？我有行动吗？我做了我说的吗？我当时是怎么想的？原始原因与现实相比？
  • How well did it or didn’t it work out? Did I act? Did I do what I said? What did I think at the time? Original reasons compared to reality?
  • 为什么我出错了？如何？在哪里？机会成本？
  • Why did I go wrong? How? Where? Opportunity cost?
  • 我如何判断这是否会继续？我对我的错误采取了行动吗？怎样做才能不重复？我应该做什么和不做什么？我应该专注于什么？我必须改进什么？我必须学习什么？
  • How can I figure out if this is going to continue? Have I acted on my mistakes? How act to not repeat? What should I have done and didn’t do? What should I concentrate on? What must I improve? What must I learn?

究竟是什么问题？

What exactly is the problem?

  • 我想达到什么目的？为什么我不能实现我的目标？发生什么事？它是如何发生的？它在哪里发生而不发生？它什么时候发生，什么时候不发生？谁受到影响？
  • What do I want to achieve? Why don’t I achieve my goal? What happen? How does it happen? Where does it happen and not? When does it happen and not? Who’s affected?
  • 是什么导致了我的目标？是什么干扰了导致我进球的因素？症状还是核心原因？实现我的目标最重要的限制因素是什么？我基于什么原则或假设？如果他们错了会有什么后果？假设没有限制，最好的行动方案是什么？其他后果？
  • What causes my goal? What interferes with the factors that cause my goal? Symptoms or core cause? What is the single most important limiting factor for reaching my goal? What principles or assumptions do I base this on? What are the consequences if they are wrong? Assuming no limitations, what would be the best course of action? Other consequences?

考虑到人类行为可能产生的后果是什么？

What are the likely consequences considering Human behaviour?

是什么让我这样做？

What is causing me to do this?

我现在的环境和心态是怎样的？如果我想避免痛苦，做什么/说什么对我有好处？我认为对我有什么影响？他们是痛苦的还是愉快的？哪些心理倾向会影响我？他们是否有可能造成误判？

What are my present environment and my state of mind? What is rewarding for me to do/say if I want to avoid pain? What do I perceive to be the consequences for me? Are they painful or pleasurable? What psychological tendencies will influence me? Are they likely to cause a misjudgement?

上下文是什么？

What is the context?

环境和参与者（包括规模）是什么样的？谁是决策者，他的决策标准是什么？谁受益谁买单？谁对结果负责？谁和什么在影响参与者对现实的感知？

What does the environment and participants (incl. size) look like? Who is the decision-maker and what are his criteria for making decisions? Who benefits and who pay? Who is responsible for outcome? Who and what are influencing the participant s perception of reality?

我能评判他吗？

Can I judge him?

我能判断他的人品吗？他的经历是什么？哪些暂时或永久的特征会影响他（年龄、文化背景、健康状况、情绪……）？什么环境（目前的内部和外部）或情境因素影响他？他想卖给我什么东西吗？

Can I judge his character? What are his experiences? What temporary or permanent characteristics influence him (age, cultural background, health, mood...)? What environmental (present internal and external) or situational factors influence him? Does he want to sell me something?

做什么符合他的自身利益？

What is in his self-interest to do?

他这样做合乎逻辑吗？如果他想避免痛苦，做什么对他有好处？他认为什么是痛苦的？他害怕什么，为什么？他更想要什么或者他不想被带走什么？是什么“资源”激励着他？他的健康、工作、家庭、职位、名誉、地位、权力？什么会给他一个激励或抑制？什么奖励或惩罚制度导致他的行为？他因做什么而获得（感知）奖励？他因做什么而受到（感知）惩罚？他是如何衡量的？他如何看待非目标的后果？相信（或不相信）某事对他有利/有兴趣吗？

What is logical for him to do? What is rewarding for him to do if he want to avoid pain? What does he perceive as painful? What does he fear and why? What does he want more of or what does he not want to be taken away? What"resources" motivates him? His health, job, family, position, reputation, status, power? What would give him an incentive or disincentive? What reward or penalty system causes his behaviour? What is he rewarded (perceived) for doing? What is he punished (perceived) for doing? How is he measured? How does he perceive the consequences of non-goal? Is it to his advantage/interest to believe (or not to believe) something?

影响他的心理倾向和捷径有哪些，容易造成误判？

What are the psychological tendencies and shortcuts that influence him and can cause misjudgement?

什么偏见影响了他的结论？有什么外部影响，可能会影响他？有什么诱惑可以满足他的私利？是什么激活了他的行为？

What bias affects his conclusions? What external influences is there, that will likely influence him? What temptations are there that appeal to his self-interest? What activates his behaviour?

后果是什么？

What are the consequences?

对我有什么后果？我的目标还能实现吗？对他有益的东西对我也有益吗？系统设置是否使相关参与者的兴趣与我的目标一致？做出错误的决定会让他“付出代价”吗？他是否了解自己行为的后果？对他的短期和长期后果是什么？责任线是什么？他对后果负责吗？当其他人也这样做时会发生什么？

What are the consequences for me? Will my goal still be achieved? Is what is rewarding for him also rewarding for me? Is the system set up so that the relevant participants interest coincides with my goal? Does it"pay him" to make the wrong decision? Does he understand the consequences of his behaviour? What are the short-and long-term consequences for him? What are the lines of responsibility? Does he have the responsibility for the consequences? What happens when others do the same?

如果角色互换，我希望拥有什么样的系统？

What system would I like to have if the roles were reversed?

如果角色互换，我希望得到怎样的对待？是什么促使我去做我想让他做的事？我可以使用哪些行为倾向来改变他的行为？如果我想保证不进球，我应该怎么做？我现在可以转身避开那些吗？

How would I like to be treated if the roles were reversed? What would cause me to do the things I want him to do? What are the behavioural tendencies I can use to change his behaviour? How shall I behave if I want to guarantee non-goal? Can I now turn around and avoid those?

这是正确的系统吗？

Is this the right system?

我可以诉诸于他的自身利益吗？我可以诉诸对失去名誉、金钱、地位、家庭……的恐惧吗？我可以将他目前的联想改为疼痛吗？我如何组织系统以最小化某些影响？我有没有告诉他我的期望？我检查过做了什么吗？我支持事情做得好吗？他是否具备必要的技能、知识和相关信息？他知道对他的期望是什么吗？他知道目标吗，他将如何到达它，为什么这是最好的道路？他能衡量他的进步吗？这与他的日常活动有关吗？他有责任和权力吗？他的奖励是否与目标一致？我可以设置哪些规则来考虑人的弱点？我可以安装反向规则吗？必须做出哪些改变？谁会召唤他们？那有多大可能？他的价值观是什么？他的目标？他认为什么是结果？如果他按照我们希望的方式行事，如果他不这样做，他对后果的看法是什么？

Can I appeal to his self-interest? Can I appeal to fear of losing reputation, money, status, family..? Can I change his present associations to pain? How can I organize the system to minimize certain influences? Have I told him what I expect? Have I inspected what is done? Have I supported things done well? Does he have the necessary skills, knowledge and the relevant information? Does he know what is expected of him? Does he know the goal, how he will reach it and why that is the best path? Can he measure his progress? Is it related to his daily activities? Does he have the responsibility and the authority? Is his reward aligned with the goal? What rules can I install that will consider human weaknesses? Can I install a reverse rule? What changes must be made? Who will call for them? How likely is that? What are his values? His goals? What does he consider to be result? What is his perception of the consequences if he behave like we want him to and if he doesn’t?

企业评价

Business evaluation

过滤器 1 我能理解业务——可预测性吗？

Filter 1 Can I understand the business — predictability?

  • 需求原因我有多确定（并能解释为什么）人们将来可能会继续购买此类产品或服务？过去发生了什么，未来可能发生什么？周期性需求？产能与需求？
  • Reasons for demand How certain am I that (and can explain why) people are likely to continue buy this type of product or service in the future? What has happened in the past and what is likely to happen in the future? Cyclically in demand? Capacity versus demand?
  • 回报特征过去十年行业和公司的回报特征和变化？
  • Return characteristics Industry and company return characteristics and change over the last ten years?
  • 行业结构没有竞争对手和规模？谁规定了这个行业的条款？在这个行业赚钱需要什么？在行业中的地位？我知道谁会在这个市场上赚钱吗？为什么？
  • Industry structure No of competitors and size? Who dictate the terms in this industry? What is needed to make money in this industry? Position within the industry? Do I know who is going to make the money in this market and why?
  • 真正的客户——谁决定买什么，他的决策标准是什么？
  • Real Customer -Who decides what to buy and what are his decision-criteria?

过滤器 2 企业是否具有某种可持续的竞争优势？

Filter 2 Does it look like the business has some kind of sustainable competitive advantage?

  • 竞争优势我有多确定（并能解释为什么）他们可能会从公司而不是其他人那里购买产品或服务？原因与十年前几乎没有变化吗？这些动机在未来十年内是否可能保持不变？
  • Competitive Advantage How certain am I that (and can explain why) they are likely to buy the product or service from the company rather than from someone else? Are the reasons virtually unchanged from what they were ten years ago? Are these motivations likely to be unchanged over the next ten years?
  • 价值——这种优势有多强大和可持续？这些年来优势是否变得更强大、更持久？什么可以破坏或减少它们？进入壁垒？品牌忠诚度？易受需求或价格变化的影响？容易复制吗？产品生命周期短？客户成本和更换供应商的动机？与竞争的年度成本差异？需要资本投资？议价能力？过时的风险？新的客户选择？购买习惯或购买力的改变？假设成本结构相同，竞争对手是否有可能降价？需要什么来确保优势保持可持续？增长机会还剩多少？对产品的需求可能会增长吗？未开发的单位体积需求？定价权？
  • Value — How strong and sustainable is this advantage? Have the advantages become stronger and more durable over the years? What can destroy or reduce them? Barriers to entry? Brand loyalty? Vulnerable to change in demand or prices? Easy to copy? Short product life cycle? Customer cost and incentive to switch supplier? Annual cost differential against competition? Capital investments needed? Bargaining power? Obsolescence risk? New customer alternatives? Change in buying habits or power? Competitor potential to undercut prices assuming same cost structure? What is needed to make sure the advantages stay sustainable? Growth opportunities left? Is the demand for the product likely to grow? Untapped unit volume demand? Pricing power?
  • 盈利能力优势能否转化为盈利能力？为什么？公司如何赚钱？需要多少资本才能产生增量收入？财务特征——资本回报率（营业利润率和资本周转率）、毛利率、销售增长、成本以及资本结构和效率？标准化的自由现金流？规模优势？关键变量？
  • Profitability Can the advantage be translated into profitability and why? How does the company make money? How much capital is needed to produce incremental revenues? Financial characteristics — return on capital (operating margins and capital turnover), gross margins, sales growth, costand capital structure and efficiency? Normalized free cash flow? Advantages of scale? Critical variable?

过滤器 3 能干和诚实的管理？

Filter 3 Able and honest management?

  • 管理层是否由理解并专注于创造价值的有能力和诚实的人组成？
  • Is the management composed of competent and honest people that understands and focuses on creation of value?

过滤器 4 — 价格合适吗？

Filter 4 — Is the price right?

  • 我能否以提供良好回报的价格购买，与其他可用替代品相比具有巨大的安全边际，并有事实和数据的证据？
  • Can I buy at a price that provides a good return with a huge margin of safety measured against other available alternatives and with evidence from facts and figures?

过滤器 5 - 反驳

Filter 5 — Disprove

  • 企业怎么会被扼杀？如果公司可以杀死它的竞争对手之一，那会是谁，为什么？如果公司要离开 5 年，他们会押注哪个竞争对手，为什么？企业对逆境的抵抗力如何？假设公司支付了所有股本，它还有任何价值吗？拥有数十亿美元和人才的人能否成功与公司竞争？如果竞争对手不关心回报，他会造成多大的损失？衰退敏感性？执行风险？新技术会帮助还是伤害？
  • How can the business get killed? If the company could kill one of its competitors, who would it be and why? If the company would go away for 5 years which competitor would they bet on and why? How resistant is the business to adversity? Assume the company paid out all its equity capital, would it still have any value? Could someone with the access to billions of dollars and talent, successfully compete with the company? How much damage could a competitor do if he doesn’t care about returns? Recession sensitivity? Execution risk? Will new technology help or hurt?

过滤器 6 如果我错了会有什么后果？

Filter 6 What are the consequences if I’m wrong?
